notes_display: Rev. die cracks, slightly double struck
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right Profile of Shapur II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three floral elements; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the lorymbos, pointing upwards, pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair, pointing upwards, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 5 h l. o. mzdysn bgy šhpwhly MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Šābuhr šāhān šāh Ēran kē čihr az yazdān| "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Shapur, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image| brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; shaft shown with three vertical lines; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strockes, to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; left and right of alter table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l.o NWRA ZY, 9 h l. o. Šhpwhly| ādur ī Šābuhr| “the fire of Shapur”
